user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_BinSemGetInfo_Impl:
```c
int32 OS_BinSemGetInfo_Impl(const OS_object_token_t *token, OS_bin_sem_prop_t *sem_prop)
{
    OS_impl_binsem_internal_record_t *sem;

    sem = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_impl_bin_sem_table, *token);

    /* put the info into the structure */
    sem_prop->value = sem->current_value;
    return OS_SUCCESS;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function OS_BinSemGetInfo_Impl:
typedef struct OS_object_token OS_object_token_t
...
typedef struct
{
    char      name[OS_MAX_API_NAME];
    osal_id_t creator;
    int32     value;
} OS_bin_sem_prop_t
...
typedef struct
{
    pthread_mutex_t       id;
    pthread_cond_t        cv;
    volatile sig_atomic_t flush_request;
    volatile sig_atomic_t current_value;
} OS_impl_binsem_internal_record_t
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(tbl, tok) (&tbl[OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(&(tok))])
...
OS_impl_binsem_internal_record_t OS_impl_bin_sem_table[OS_MAX_BIN_SEMAPHORES]
...
static inline osal_index_t OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(const OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    return token->obj_idx;
}
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
#define OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(tbl, tok) (&tbl[OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(&(tok))])
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 8.13 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The macro expands to a non-const pointer to a table element and the code assigns that to a non-const sem pointer even though the function only reads from the record. Specifically, sem = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_impl_bin_sem_table, *token) yields an OS_impl_binsem_internal_record_t * (non-const). The function only reads sem->current_value, so sem (and/or the macro return type) should be a pointer to const-qualified type (const OS_impl_binsem_internal_record_t *) to comply with MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13.
